conclusion: To find the work done by the gas from state B to state C, analyze the p-V diagram.
The process from B to C is a horizontal line, indicating constant pressure at 2 x 10^5 Pa.
The volume at state B is 2 x 10^-3 m^3 and at state C is 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
The change in volume (ΔV) is 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
The work done by the gas during a constant pressure process is W = P ΔV.
Substituting the values, W = (2 x 10^5 Pa) x (1 x 10^-3 m^3) = 200 J.
The work done by the gas from state B to state C is 200 J.
